title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts is the first state to introduce ChatGPT for executive branch employees, drawing public criticism.
Governor Maura Healey assures the AI tool will operate securely and improve government efficiency.
65% of surveyed readers oppose the AI rollout, citing privacy, security, and environmental concerns.

title: What a traveling nurse experienced on the hard-hit Cape after Monday’s blizzard
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cape Cod recovering after blizzard; 50,000 residents still without power, down from 160,000 earlier in the week.
Traveling nurse Colleen Wright navigated severe conditions to reach elderly clients across the Cape for crucial check-ins.
Emergency shelters in Provincetown, Harwich, Mashpee, and Barnstable housing 200 people, mainly elderly with medical needs.

title: City Council rejects effort to ask Wu administration for info on ICE detainer requests
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council rejected Councilor Ed Flynn's effort to request information on ICE detainer requests from the Wu administration.
Flynn's proposal sought details on detainer requests since 2024, including Boston Police Department's responses and open criminal cases.
Nine councilors opposed Flynn's request, citing concerns over supporting a false narrative about immigrant-driven violence.

title: Here’s why Boston streets seem clearer than after the last big storm
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu credits extended parking bans for improved snow removal after recent Boston blizzard.
Over 200 truckloads of snow were hauled away in a single day due to new daytime removal strategy.
Boston considers additional fees for property owners failing to clear sidewalks, focusing on priority areas.

title: This Mass. bride and groom skied Killington fresh off their vows and in wedding attire
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Evan and Kristyn Brophy Stark skied in a wedding gown and suit at Killington after their mountainside ceremony.
The couple planned their wedding at Killington Resort to include skiing, celebrating with over 100 guests afterwards.
Their romance began via Hinge in 2021 and included a mountain proposal and a ski-themed wedding celebration.

title: Report: Anfernee Simons played with wrist fracture during time with Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Anfernee Simons played 49 games for the Celtics with a fractured wrist sustained during training camp.
The Celtics traded Simons and a pick to the Bulls for Nikola Vucevic, who averages 9.9 points and 7.7 rebounds.
Simons has missed the Bulls’ last two games and is set to miss a third due to aggravated wrist injury.

title: MBTA Commuter Rail experiences more delays due to snow cleanup and vehicle on track
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MBTA Commuter Rail faced delays due to nearly three feet of snow and a vehicle on the Worcester line.
Service changes affected Fairmount, Fall River/New Bedford, Fitchburg, and other lines due to ongoing snow cleanup.
A Boston.com poll showed 59% disapproval of MBTA services during recent harsh winter conditions.

title: All Mass. residents to get free access to Google AI training classes, Healey says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts residents to receive free access to Google's AI and technology online courses through a new partnership with the state.
Governor Maura Healey emphasizes AI's importance to the economy, pushing to make Massachusetts a leading AI hub.
The Grow with Google program offers courses on topics like AI, digital marketing, and cybersecurity until the end of 2027.

title: Charlie McAvoy apologizes for Team USA’s reaction to Trump joke about US women’s team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy apologized for Team USA men's reaction to Donald Trump's joke about the US women's hockey team.
Trump made a joke about the US women's team during a call, leading to laughter from several men's team members.
McAvoy emphasized the strong bond and mutual support between the men's and women's hockey teams during the Olympics.

title: Mayor Jake Wilson plans to tackle Somerville’s housing crisis. Will it work?
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Mayor Jake Wilson prioritizes more density, new zoning, and affordable housing investment for Somerville.
Somerville's housing saw a 5.6% increase in units from 2020 to 2025, yet home prices soared.
Wilson supports a 299-unit Broadway project with 132 affordable units as a model for future developments.
